Pre-Game Insights: New Orleans Pelicans are looking to break their three-game road skid.
Orlando Magic finished 47-35 overall last season while going 29-12 at home.
The Magic averaged 110.5 points per game last season, with 51.8 points in the paint, 18.6 off turnovers, and 12.4 on fast breaks.
New Orleans Pelicans went 49-33 overall last season while going 28-14 on the road.
The Pelicans averaged 115.1 points per game while allowing opponents to score 110.7 last season.
Key injuries for the Magic include Paolo Banchero (abdomen) and Wendell Carter Jr. (foot).

Key injuries for the Pelicans include Trey Murphy III (hamstring), CJ McCollum (adductor), Herbert Jones (shoulder), and Dejounte Murray (hand). Zion Williamson and Jordan Hawkins are day-to-day with hamstring and back issues, respectively.
